summary: Primeape
title: Primeape
excerpt: The evolved form of Mankey, Primeape is a Fighting-type Pokemon who is quite prone to anger. When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time. Primeape was one of Akari's Pokémon. Along with Mankey, Machop, Machamp, and all the Hitmon fighters, they had faced one of their critical failures. Since Akari had no idea how to deal with Talon, and because they didn't want...

summary: Van: Kyuuu--Mimikyuuuu! Roxas: -sigh- You could at least say some kind of “thank you”. But you’re right, Anon, that’s probably...
caption:
Van: Kyuuu–Mimikyuuuu!

Roxas: -sigh- You could at least say some kind of “thank you”. But you’re right, Anon, that’s probably the look he gives me the most. Or anyone really. He’s not one to give someone the time of day unless it involves battling. Isn’t that right, Van?

Van: MI-mikyu.

Roxas: Language-! V_V

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1574: Zekrom EX (Next Destinies)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1574: Zekrom EX (Next Destinies)
body:
There was already a Reshiram EX and Kyurem EX in the Next Destinies set, so it was only fitting that there was a Zekrom EX as well. Of course, Lightning didn’t need any more good attackers to play alongside Eelektrik, but that wasn’t going to stop more from showing up. This Zekrom had higher HP and a stronger attack than the lower form but required more Energy and couldn’t use Outrage when low on HP. These trade-offs meant that it might not have been a straight replacement for Zekrom. Even being equal to something that could would be enough to be a top-tier threat, at least.

180 HP was spectacular. Sure, it was balanced somewhat by giving up 2 Prizes when Knocked Out, but only Pokemon picking on the Fighting Weakness or Black Kyurem EX were likely to do that. Other Pokemon took 2 or sometimes even 3 attacks to chip away at that. One annoying trait here was that Zekrom EX needed a lot of Energy to retreat. You didn’t want to pay 3 Energy even in a deck running Eelektrik. Bring along your Switch and Float Stone.

Glinting Claw technically existed, I guess. 50 damage with a flip for 30 more for 3 Energy? Not enough in 2012, especially for a Lightning-type.

You were really here for Strong Volt. Sure, it required 4 Energy and discarding of 2, 150 damage was just below what was needed to KO a Pokemon EX, but it was enough to take out a lot of those Stage 2 Pokemon that the main Zekrom couldn’t. That, along with the bulk and lack of recoil, was Zekrom EX’s niche in a Lightning deck. Not huge, but very nice in some games.

Zekrom EX was another really nice attacker that Eelektrik could work with. The need to discard worked very nicely with Eelektrik’s ability to recycle them, making it a natural fit. It was amazing that this card wasn’t a must-run. There were simply so many incredible choices to work with that you sometimes just ended up cutting a couple of attackers like this. Zekrom Ex was still a reasonably common sight late in the HGSS-On and for a while in the BLW-On formats even with the likes of Zekrom, Tornadus EX, Raikou EX, Zapdos, Mewtwo EX, and Rayquaza EX being competition. It was that good.

summary: While researchers still aren’t exactly sure what determines a Wurmple to evolve into Silcoon or Cascoon, it seems that their...
body: While researchers still aren’t exactly sure what determines a Wurmple to evolve into Silcoon or Cascoon, it seems that their personality is a strong factor. Wurmple that more passive and calm tend to evolve into Silcoon while ones that are more aggressive are more likely to evolve into Cascoon.

reblog.comment: While researchers still aren’t exactly sure what determines a Wurmple to evolve into Silcoon or Cascoon, it seems that their personality is a strong factor. Wurmple that more passive and calm tend to evolve into Silcoon while ones that are more aggressive are more likely to evolve into Cascoon.

Wurmple that more passive and calm tend to evolve into Silcoon while ones that are more aggressive are more likely to evolve into Cascoon.
trail.content: While researchers still aren’t exactly sure what determines a Wurmple to evolve into Silcoon or Cascoon, it seems that their personality is a strong factor. Wurmple that more passive and calm tend to evolve into Silcoon while ones that are more aggressive are more likely to evolve into Cascoon.

summary: My daughter and I have been working this project since December in preparation for Salt Lake FanX this weekend. It all started...
caption:
My daughter and I have been working this project since December in preparation for Salt Lake FanX this weekend. It all started when she was begging me to take her to Disneyland. Obviously, that’s very expensive to take the whole family, and we couldn’t afford it. So I told her she had to earn the money to take our family. So she has been making these for the last few months to sell. It’s been a lot of fun teaching her how to do it and we often did therapy sessions for our Pokemon about how it wasn’t scary to get glued down into their new homes and it wouldn’t hurt. 😂

If you are heading to FanX this weekend in Salt Lake, be sure to stop by and say hi! We’ll be at table GO18 with the Spider Forest Webcomic Collective!
—> Swipe for more pictures!

#Pokemon #saltlakefanx #craft #terrarium #pikachu #hamdmade
https://www.instagram.com/p/BwSKaJAFtjZ/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=l4zqyam4ysc

blog.name: pokemon-professor-sakura
blog.title: Asks: OPEN! Submissions: OPEN!
blog.description:
(This is a roleplay blog run by @chickadee567)

((Talking out of character))

Hello there! I’m Professor Sakura, and I’m always willing

to help trainers and caretakers with their Pokemon.

You can ask me about Pokemon behavior, where certain Pokemon can be found,

and even report sightings of rare or mythical Pokemon.

((Search for the tag #rules to find rules for asks and submissions!))

summary: Hi, it’s the same anon that’s in the blackout right now. The Pokémon has red eyes and it’s in the shadows I can’t really see it...
question: Hi, it’s the same anon that’s in the blackout right now. The Pokémon has red eyes and it’s in the shadows I can’t really see it clearly and I’m scared to shine my phone’s flashlight at it.
answer:
Red eyes…in the shadows…that narrows it down a little. Is it more human-like or more dragon-like?

- Professor Sakura

question: 6, 11 and 18
answer:
6. Favorite gen

I’m kinda tied between Gen 5 Unova and Gen 7 Alola, in terms of the new Pokemon gen 5 barely beats gen 7, but I’m torn between the moral struggle with N and how much I love Guzma and Team Skull in terms of story.

11. Favorite eeveelution

I always liked Leafeon

18. Favorite ice type

Ice types are one of those types I don’t really have personal favorites in, cause none of my faves are ice types, but Lapras and Spheal are pretty cool, I wish Spheal would stay this round and adorable though

tags: god I hope someone will commission me with something pokemon related that'd ve everything
sorry I doubt that this was helpful
summary: yo!!! first of all, you’re good and valid and ily, and also!! can you give me some cool Pokémon? I’m very into it + used it to...
question: yo!!! first of all, you’re good and valid and ily, and also!! can you give me some cool Pokémon? I’m very into it + used it to cope with severe depression as well and I wanna make a Pokésona to sort of,, say my thanks for keeping me alive and kicking! I’m a big fan of rodents and more ‘gross’ creatures so don’t be afraid to suggest anything taboo! (I’m kind of already considering Skiddo and Umbreon because Butch and Emo Gay, any thoughts?) sorry if this isn’t appropriate I just love reminiscing
answer:
Pokemon is great!! I still need to decide on a Pokemon for my pokesona some day.

There are quite a lot of rodent Pokemon, let me just list them all: the pikachu line, rattata/raticate, nidoran line, sentret/furret, zigzagoon/linoone, bidoof/bibarel, pachirisu, buneary/lopunny, patrat/watchog, minccino/cinccino, emolga, bunnelby/diggersby, dedenne, yungoos/gunshoos and togedemaru.

My personal favorites from them are furret, buneary, lopunny, bidoof and minccino. I don’t know if this helps in any way. In the end you have to choose the one you like the best.

For gross or just cool creatures I’m thinking tangrowth, kabutops, houndoom, tyranitar, slaking, exploud, sableye, mawile, aggron, armaldo, dusclops, deoxys, purugly, toxicroak, golisopod, kommo-o and like all ultra beasts and… many more big and buff guys u know

reblog.comment:
Pokemon is great!! I still need to decide on a Pokemon for my pokesona some day.

There are quite a lot of rodent Pokemon, let me just list them all: the pikachu line, rattata/raticate, nidoran line, sentret/furret, zigzagoon/linoone, bidoof/bibarel, pachirisu, buneary/lopunny, patrat/watchog, minccino/cinccino, emolga, bunnelby/diggersby, dedenne, yungoos/gunshoos and togedemaru.

My personal favorites from them are furret, buneary, lopunny, bidoof and minccino. I don’t know if this helps in any way. In the end you have to choose the one you like the best.

For gross or just cool creatures I’m thinking tangrowth, kabutops, houndoom, tyranitar, slaking, exploud, sableye, mawile, aggron, armaldo, dusclops, deoxys, purugly, toxicroak, golisopod, kommo-o and like all ultra beasts and… many more big and buff guys u know
